candidates.title: Grandparents to 'Get All Their Grandchildren Every Weekend'
candidates.content:
Claim:
President Obama passed a law requiring grandparents to pick up pick up their grandchildren every weekend.
On 27 October 2016, the web site React365 published a hoax news article, which reported that President Obama had passed a law that required grandparents to take care of their grandchildren every weekend:
Grandparents must pickup up all their grandchildren every weekend no matter what or they will be fined 5000$ or 35 days in jail pickup must start this Friday and if not parents must call the local police station..
There is no truth to the story quoted here. React365 is a "prank" web site that does not publish factual stories:
This website is an entertainment website, news are created by users. These are humourous news, fantasy, fictional, that should not be seriously taken or as a source of information.
The content on React 365 is generated by users. After clicking the "create a joke" button, people are taken to a screen to fill out a fake news template. The web site generates the hoax news story and then encourages you to share it with your friends on social media in order to "prank" them:
There is, of course, no law mandating that grandparents have to see their grandchildren.
candidates.description: Reports that President Obama had passed a law requiring grandparents to "pick up" their grandchildren every weekend came from a site that generates user-created hoax news.

result.explanation: The news caption is False. Snopes.com directly debunks the claim, stating it originated from a hoax news website, React365, known for user-generated prank news.  The site explicitly states there is no such law.
result.supporting_points: Source 1: Snopes.com article debunks the claim, citing React365 as the origin of the hoax news story.  React365 is identified as a website that generates user-created hoax news and entertainment content, not factual reporting. The article explicitly states 'There is, of course, no law mandating that grandparents have to see their grandchildren.'

final_result.explanation:
The original news caption, "President Obama passed a law requiring Grandparents to Get All Their Grandchildren Every Weekend," is completely out of context with the provided image.  The image depicts a heartwarming scene of grandparents interacting with their baby grandchild, suggesting a loving and voluntary family interaction. The caption, however, asserts the existence of a law mandated by President Obama, which is factually incorrect and unrelated to the image's content. 

Internal validation reveals a clear disconnect. The image shows a peaceful, intimate moment between family members. There's no indication of legal proceedings or any forced interaction.  The caption introduces elements (a law, President Obama's involvement) entirely absent from the visual narrative. The internal check's confidence score of 0 reflects this complete lack of correlation.  The explanation clearly states that the image and caption are unrelated.

External validation strongly supports the internal assessment.  The external check, using Snopes.com as a source, definitively debunks the claim of such a law. The external validation provides strong evidence that the caption is a hoax originating from a prank news website known for its false and fabricated stories. This source not only confirms the falsity of the claim but also provides context about the origin of the misinformation, further strengthening the confidence in the result. The external check's confidence score of 10 underscores the certainty of the fact-checking process.

There is no disagreement between the internal and external checks. Both independently and conclusively determine that the caption is false and entirely unrelated to the image. The high confidence score of 10 reflects this unified and well-supported conclusion.  There is no visual evidence in the image to support the claim made in the caption. No elements, objects, or textual cues within the image allude to a law, legal proceedings, or any forced interaction between grandparents and grandchildren. The image's serene and loving atmosphere contrasts sharply with the aggressive and legally binding tone of the caption.

In summary, the caption is demonstrably false and completely unrelated to the image. Both the internal and external validation processes independently confirm this.  There is no ambiguity or uncertainty, making the conclusion highly reliable and deserving of the highest confidence score.
final_result.validation_summary: Both internal and external validation processes strongly confirm that the caption is false and completely out of context with the image.  The internal check identifies no visual or textual cues to support the caption, while the external check uses a reputable source (Snopes.com) to debunk the claim made in the caption.  There is complete agreement between the two methods.
